column4: Question: how do i set up unbutu so i have all user "permissions"?
rewt: when i try and delete folders, or move folders, or do most anything, it says i do not have appropiate permissions
what areas of the computer are you moving around files and stuff?
things in /dev /media, and the "desktop"
you should have full permisssion on desktop...for /media you are probably not mounting devices with the correct permissions
what devices are you mounting in your /media folder?
my second hard drive
you used the pastebin before?
no, i havnt
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
open that up in a browser..
in terminal do     cat /etc/fstab
copy and paste the output into that webpage...hit send....then show me the new URL it creates
paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9149
thanks..
hmm you do everything in root?
you should have access to everything with root.....its a bad practice you know :)
you don't have a swap partition btw ...and you are not mounting your other drive at startup currently
ohkee.. I will poke around some more. I'm a total newbie, so, you know, haha
can you pastebin the output of this command    sudo fdsik -l
doh..type
sudo fdisk -l
you probably don't need sudo since you are logged in as root I suppose :)
including the 'http://' in the link you paste is helpful too :)
